Headline_Short: Trump Announces Steel Tariffs
Description_Long: President Trump announces tariffs of 25% on steel and 10% on aluminum imports, citing national security. Major trading partners express concern and threaten retaliation.

Headline_Short: US-China Trade War Begins: Tariffs Imposed
Description_Long: US imposes 25% tariffs on $34 billion of Chinese goods. China immediately retaliates with tariffs on $34 billion of US goods. Affects agriculture, autos, tech.

Headline_Short: US Midterm Elections
Description_Long: Democrats gain control of the House of Representatives, Republicans retain Senate. Potential for increased political gridlock and policy uncertainty.

Headline_Short: US Raises Tariffs on $200B of Chinese Goods
Description_Long: US increases tariffs on $200 billion of Chinese goods from 10% to 25% as trade talks stall. Heightens trade tensions.

Headline_Short: China Labels US Currency Manipulator
Description_Long: China's central bank allows yuan to weaken past 7 per dollar; US Treasury Department labels China a currency manipulator. Escalates trade war.

Headline_Short: Drone Attack on Saudi Aramco Facilities
Description_Long: Major drone attack on Saudi Aramco's Abqaiq and Khurais oil processing facilities disrupts nearly half of Saudi Arabia's oil production (5% of global supply).

Headline_Short: US Kills Iranian General Soleimani
Description_Long: US airstrike in Baghdad kills top Iranian commander Qassem Soleimani. Heightens geopolitical tensions in the Middle East; oil prices spike.

Headline_Short: US-China Phase One Trade Deal Signed
Description_Long: US and China sign 'Phase One' trade agreement. China commits to purchase more US goods, US rolls back some tariffs. Some structural issues remain unaddressed.

Headline_Short: WHO Declares COVID-19 a Global Pandemic
Description_Long: The World Health Organization officially declares the novel coronavirus (COVID-19) outbreak a global pandemic. Triggers market panic and widespread lockdowns.

Headline_Short: US Presidential Election 2020
Description_Long: Joe Biden wins the US Presidential Election against incumbent Donald Trump. Results contested, leading to period of uncertainty.

Headline_Short: Attack on US Capitol Building
Description_Long: Pro-Trump protestors storm the US Capitol building during certification of election results. Highlights deep political divisions.

Headline_Short: Suez Canal Blockage by Ever Given
Description_Long: Container ship Ever Given runs aground in the Suez Canal, blocking one of the world's busiest trade routes for nearly a week. Disrupts global supply chains.

Headline_Short: US Withdrawal from Afghanistan Concludes
Description_Long: The last US troops leave Afghanistan, ending a 20-year war. Taliban rapidly takes control of the country.

Headline_Short: Russia Invades Ukraine
Description_Long: Russia launches a full-scale invasion of Ukraine. Triggers major geopolitical crisis, sanctions on Russia, and sharp increases in energy and commodity prices.

Headline_Short: UK Mini-Budget Triggers Market Turmoil
Description_Long: UK government announces large unfunded tax cuts, leading to a sharp fall in the British Pound and a surge in UK government bond yields. Bank of England intervention required.

Headline_Short: US Imposes Sweeping Chip Export Controls on China
Description_Long: Biden administration announces extensive new export controls aimed at hobbling China's ability to develop advanced semiconductors.

Headline_Short: Silicon Valley Bank (SVB) Collapses
Description_Long: Silicon Valley Bank, a key lender to tech startups, collapses after a bank run, marking the largest US bank failure since 2008. Triggers fears of wider banking crisis.

Headline_Short: UBS Agrees to Buy Credit Suisse
Description_Long: UBS agrees to an emergency takeover of troubled rival Credit Suisse, brokered by Swiss authorities to prevent a wider financial meltdown.

Headline_Short: Hamas Attacks Israel, Triggering Major Conflict
Description_Long: Hamas launches a surprise large-scale attack on Israel from Gaza, leading to significant casualties and a declaration of war by Israel. Heightens Middle East tensions.

Headline_Short: US & UK Launch Airstrikes Against Houthis in Yemen
Description_Long: US and UK conduct joint airstrikes against Houthi targets in Yemen in response to attacks on Red Sea shipping. Concerns over regional escalation and supply chain disruption.

Headline_Short: US Withdraws from Iran Nuclear Deal
Description_Long: President Trump announces US withdrawal from the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) with Iran and reimposition of sanctions.

Headline_Short: Brexit Deadline Extended (First Time)
Description_Long: UK Parliament fails to approve Brexit withdrawal agreement, EU grants short extension to original March 29 deadline.

Headline_Short: UK and EU Announce Revised Brexit Deal
Description_Long: UK PM Boris Johnson and EU leaders announce they have agreed on a revised Brexit withdrawal agreement.

Headline_Short: UK and EU Announce Post-Brexit Trade Deal
Description_Long: UK and EU announce they have reached a trade and cooperation agreement just days before the end of the Brexit transition period.

Headline_Short: Nancy Pelosi Visits Taiwan, Angering China
Description_Long: US House Speaker Nancy Pelosi visits Taiwan despite strong objections and military threats from China. Heightens US-China tensions.

Headline_Short: Wagner Group Mutiny in Russia
Description_Long: Yevgeny Prigozhin, leader of the Wagner mercenary group, launches a short-lived armed rebellion against Russia's military leadership.

Headline_Short: George Floyd Killing Sparks Global Protests
Description_Long: The killing of George Floyd by police in Minneapolis sparks widespread protests against racial injustice and police brutality across the US and globally.

Headline_Short: China Celebrates CCP Centenary, Xi Jinping Speech
Description_Long: China holds massive celebrations for the 100th anniversary of the Chinese Communist Party. Xi Jinping delivers a nationalistic speech.

Headline_Short: Missile Lands in Poland, Initial Fears of NATO Escalation
Description_Long: A missile strike in Polish territory near the Ukrainian border initially sparks fears of a direct NATO-Russia confrontation before being assessed as likely a stray Ukrainian air defense missile.

Headline_Short: Croatia Adopts Euro, Joins Schengen Area
Description_Long: Croatia becomes the 20th member of the Eurozone and joins the Schengen passport-free travel area.

Headline_Short: Jamal Khashoggi Disappearance
Description_Long: Saudi journalist Jamal Khashoggi disappears after entering the Saudi consulate in Istanbul, Turkey. Leads to international condemnation and questions about Saudi leadership.

Headline_Short: UK General Election - Conservative Majority
Description_Long: Boris Johnson's Conservative Party wins a large majority in the UK general election, paving the way for Brexit to proceed.

Headline_Short: China Declares All Crypto Transactions Illegal
Description_Long: China's central bank declares all cryptocurrency-related transactions illegal, intensifying its crackdown on digital currencies.

Headline_Short: Ferdinand Marcos Jr. Wins Philippines Presidential Election
Description_Long: Ferdinand 'Bongbong' Marcos Jr., son of the late dictator, wins a landslide victory in the Philippine presidential election.

Headline_Short: US Announces AI Executive Order
Description_Long: President Biden signs a comprehensive executive order on artificial intelligence, aiming to establish new safety and security standards for AI development.

Headline_Short: US, UK, France Launch Airstrikes in Syria
Description_Long: The US, UK, and France launch coordinated airstrikes against Syrian government targets in response to a suspected chemical weapons attack.

Headline_Short: Venezuela Political Crisis: Guaido Declares Himself President
Description_Long: Venezuelan opposition leader Juan Guaido declares himself interim president, challenging Nicolas Maduro's rule. US and other nations recognize Guaido.

Headline_Short: EU Agrees on Landmark COVID-19 Recovery Fund
Description_Long: European Union leaders agree on a â‚¬750 billion recovery fund (NextGenerationEU) to help member states recover from the pandemic-induced economic crisis.

Headline_Short: New COVID-19 Variant 'Omicron' Sparks Global Alarm
Description_Long: WHO designates Omicron a 'variant of concern', leading to new travel restrictions and market sell-offs due to fears of renewed economic disruption.

Headline_Short: Former Japanese PM Shinzo Abe Assassinated
Description_Long: Former Japanese Prime Minister Shinzo Abe is assassinated while campaigning for a parliamentary election. Shocks Japan and the world.

Headline_Short: US Shoots Down Suspected Chinese Spy Balloon
Description_Long: US military shoots down a suspected Chinese high-altitude surveillance balloon off the coast of South Carolina, increasing US-China tensions.

Headline_Short: Coronation of King Charles III
Description_Long: King Charles III is crowned at Westminster Abbey in London. Symbolic event for the UK and Commonwealth.

Headline_Short: Major Earthquake Hits Japan's West Coast
Description_Long: A powerful earthquake strikes the Noto Peninsula in Ishikawa Prefecture, Japan, causing significant damage and tsunamis.

Headline_Short: USMCA Trade Deal Reached (Replaces NAFTA)
Description_Long: US, Mexico, and Canada reach a new trade agreement, the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), to replace NAFTA.

Headline_Short: Hong Kong Protests Escalate Over Extradition Bill
Description_Long: Massive protests erupt in Hong Kong against a proposed extradition bill with mainland China, leading to widespread unrest and clashes with police.

Headline_Short: Massive Explosion in Beirut Port
Description_Long: A large explosion at the port of Beirut, Lebanon, causes widespread devastation, numerous casualties, and significant economic damage.

Headline_Short: Israel-Hamas Ceasefire Takes Effect
Description_Long: A ceasefire between Israel and Hamas comes into effect, ending 11 days of intense conflict in Gaza.

Headline_Short: Federal Reserve Hikes Interest Rates for First Time Since 2018
Description_Long: The US Federal Reserve raises its benchmark interest rate by 0.25 percentage points, signaling the start of a tightening cycle to combat inflation.

Headline_Short: Finland Joins NATO
Description_Long: Finland officially becomes the 31st member of the NATO military alliance, a direct consequence of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

Headline_Short: Threads Launched by Meta as Twitter Competitor
Description_Long: Meta launches Threads, a text-based social media app positioned as a direct competitor to Twitter (now X). Gains tens of millions of users rapidly.

Headline_Short: Portugal Snap Election
Description_Long: Portugal holds a snap general election following the resignation of the prime minister. Results indicate a shift to the right.

Headline_Short: COP27 Climate Summit in Egypt
Description_Long: World leaders and negotiators gather in Sharm El Sheikh, Egypt, for the UN Climate Change Conference (COP27) to discuss climate action.

Headline_Short: G20 Summit in Rome
Description_Long: Leaders of the G20 major economies meet in Rome to discuss global economic recovery, climate change, and international taxation.

Headline_Short: Argentina Primary Election Shock Results
Description_Long: Unexpectedly poor performance by then-President Macri in primary elections triggers market panic and sharp currency devaluation in Argentina.

Headline_Short: United Kingdom Officially Leaves the European Union (Brexit)
Description_Long: The UK formally withdraws from the EU, entering a transition period. Marks a significant shift in UK-Europe relations.
